sub_concepts.name: Real-time Operating Systems (RTOS)
sub_concepts.description: Software systems designed for real-time application requirements, providing deterministic behavior and precise timing control.

sub_concepts.name: Device Drivers
sub_concepts.description: Software components that allow the operating system to communicate with hardware devices, enabling proper functionality and control.

sub_concepts.name: Memory Management
sub_concepts.description: Techniques and algorithms used to efficiently allocate and manage memory resources within embedded systems.

sub_concepts.name: Power Management
sub_concepts.description: Methods and strategies to optimize power consumption and extend battery life in embedded devices.

sub_concepts.name: Communication Protocols
sub_concepts.description: Standards and protocols governing data exchange between embedded systems, peripherals, and external devices.

sub_concepts.name: Interrupt Handling
sub_concepts.description: Mechanisms to handle and respond to interrupts generated by hardware events, ensuring timely processing and system responsiveness.

sub_concepts.name: RTOS Scheduling
sub_concepts.description: Scheduling policies and algorithms used by real-time operating systems to prioritize tasks and allocate CPU time efficiently.

sub_concepts.name: Firmware Development
sub_concepts.description: Low-level software programming that directly interacts with hardware components to initialize, control, and manage embedded systems.

sub_concepts.name: Debugging and Testing
sub_concepts.description: Processes and tools for identifying and resolving software defects, ensuring the reliability and robustness of embedded software.

sub_concepts.name: Security Considerations
sub_concepts.description: Strategies and measures to protect embedded systems from vulnerabilities, unauthorized access, and data breaches.
